subject: RE: [junit] Help plz...
msgSnippet: ... This is true if you were only saying that. Saying write your code in a way that it doesn t need comments is very good advice, on the other hand. And in
messageBody:
Jim Dixon wrote:

> Telling people that code should not be commented, that
> comments are waste, remains extremely bad advice.

This is true if you were only saying that.

Saying "write your code in a way that it doesn't need comments" is very
good advice, on the other hand. And in my experience you *can* learn to
write code in a way that you very seldom need to fall back on this
crutch.

Just my two cents, Ilja
